channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Empty nesters are sad when their kids leave—and even more distressed when they return home
item.description: Why grown kids moving back home can be a big adjustment for parents.

item.title: Tech stocks see steepest three-week slump in two years, led by plunge in Amazon and Intel
item.description: With quarterly earnings largely in the rearview mirror, Wall Street is troubled by what it's seeing out of Silicon Valley.

item.title: Wall Street’s ‘fear gauge’ surges as panic grips stocks
Uber’s legal chief takes leave to support sister-in-law Kamala Harris’ presidential campaign
item.description: “While I love my job, my team, and the positive impact Uber has on the world, I have always believed family comes first,” Tony West wrote.

item.title: Ex-Google engineers who founded Character.AI rejoin company with new AI partnership
item.description: One of the founders previously criticized the tech giant for moving too cautiously to release artificial intelligence products.

item.title: ‘Inside Out 2’ success is AMC’s saving grace
Former CEO gets prison after plotting a $40 million payday
item.description: Jacksonville's city council auditor in 2019 uncovered a hidden incentive plan created by the exec.

item.title: Mortgage rates plunge to the lowest level in more than a year after weak employment report
item.description: The recent high on the 30-year fixed mortgage was 7.52% in late April, and home sales have been falling ever since.

item.title: U.S. stocks end with sharp losses as Nasdaq falls into correction territory
UAW chief slams Donald Trump’s labor record
item.description: Kamala Harris can boost the Democrats' chances of winning swing-state Michigan.

item.title: Google pulls AI ad for Olympics following backlash
item.description: Google was criticized for using artificial intelligence to write a fan letter to an Olympic athlete.

item.title: Nasdaq on track to enter correction territory as recession fears slam stocks
Ken Griffin pledges $12 million to defeat recreational pot legalization in Florida
item.description: The founder of Citadel and Citadel Securities, who relocated from Chicago to Miami in 2022, has been wielding his $42 billion fortune to influence Florida’s political landscape and to fund philanthropic causes.

item.title: Janus Henderson sees attractive opportunities in this corner of the real estate market
item.description: Industrial REITs have underperformed the market, resulting in some selective opportunities, according to Janus Henderson.

item.title: An ugly July jobs report revives talk of recession and bigger Fed rate cuts
